moves.1. c4: My second english as black, second lost,
moves.1... Nf6: English opening, I do not like it but it's a reason to work on it.
moves.2. g3 e5 3. Bg2: White opts for the fiancheto variation
moves.3... d5 4. cxd5 Nxd5: It seems ok for black. I often trade the center pawn.
moves.6... Nc6: Not a too bad position for the knights
moves.9. b4 Be6: White advances on the queen side, black settles in the center.
moves.10. Rb1: I don't understand this move and I do not like it.
moves.11... f5: Black's plan is to attack the e and d file but it's a bad move for it weakens black's king. (my opponent thinks it is the losing move and looking at it now, I think he is right.)
moves.12. Bd2: White carries on developping his pieces
moves.12... Bd5: With the a2 g8 diagonal open and the king on g 8, trading the bishop is a strategical mistake.
moves.13. Nxd5: White accepts the trade, of course.
moves.13... Nxd5: That was black's aim : to bring a knight on the center (The brave Lancelot was so impatient)
moves.14. Qb3: Lancelot is pined and the white bishop has fallen on battle. Only dame Guenièvre can protect her faithfull knight.
moves.14... Bf6: To enable the rook to come on the e file and to prevent 16. Nxe5 Nxe5 17. Bxd4 +
moves.15... Nce7: Perceval will at least revenge his fellow knight.
moves.16. Ng5: My opponent doesn't take but the situation is not getting better for black. At this point, I'm asking myself how I have done to be in such a situation after only 16. moves.
moves.16... c6: The footman comes and help his knight.
moves.17. Ne6: I had foreseen this move but thought, trading one rook against the advanced white knight was not so bad (compared to others possibilities).
moves.17... Qd7 18. Nxf8 Kxf8: So, Now, Lancelot will meet his doom
moves.19... cxd5: Revenge but black's situation is very bad : 4 points late in material. The fact that white has a weak pawn on the d file and that black dominates the center doesn't compensate this late.
moves.21... Qc7: Trading is not in black's favour, so dame Guenièvre has to hide behind perceval.
moves.22. fxe5: White trades as much as he can and he is definitely right.
moves.23. Qe6: White can afford a couple of mistakes
moves.25. Rbe1 Qb8: Not a safe place for dame guenièvre but are there still safe places for a lady on this battlefield.
moves.27... Qxc5 28. bxc5: No more queens on the field
moves.30. Rec1 Nxa3: To take a pawn but I should probably have plaid 30. Bd4 to keep the center complicated and protect f5. Probably Perceval's morale was no more sufficient to properly fight.
moves.31. Bd5+ Kg6: From now on, black tries to avoid the mate and hold 13. moves.
moves.32. g4 fxg4 33. Be4+ Kf7 34. Bxh7 Nb5 35: It's finished. The king is dead and the faithfull Perceval still at his side could do nothing but cry.
